speaker: Viral image
vclaim: A picture showing an undocumented immigrant with smallpox.
date: stated on April 3, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, that's not a picture of an immigrant with smallpox.
text: An old picture used to raise concerns about migrants crossing the United States-Mexico border is being abused again. "I told you they'd bring disease to our country that we've eliminated!" :: Read the accompanying article of a Facebook photo on 3 April. "The bumps on this illegal body are smallpox!" The picture shows a man without his shirt and arm up. It looks like the red bumps are covering his wing and other parts of his torso. This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) This is because the picture dates back to 2014 and shows that an immigrant suffers from scabies. On 20 January 2021, the World Health Organization (WHO) stated in the article "World Health Organization (WHO) " that its blatantly exaggerated tests confirm that the examination of individuals was positive for the Committee." By Noah Y. Kim, 22 January 2021, as we noted in the November verification of the facts, which claimed that the picture showed "crossing the border disturbances," Rep. Henry Koelar shared the original picture with Houston's magazine of facts that year. He also shared other photographs showing narrow and unhealthy conditions at a customs and border protection facility in South Texas. The picture still on Facebook shows a man with scabies, which is a treatable skin condition that can spread rapidly under crowded conditions. In particular, this prevalence has been largely contained for migrants living nearby in detention centres, although it appears that a small handful of border patrol personnel have contracted it. There is some evidence that diseases cross borders, but disease control centres describe them as extending to legal crossings between the United States and Mexico, not illegal migration. We're assessing this Facebook as pants on fire. Sharing the facts 2019-04-10 18:31 UTC PoliticsFact 1 1 7 PoliticsFact Rating: Pants on Fire A shows a picture of an undocumented immigrant with smallpox.
